chunks.en: Ramblings on Blind Dates

åæ¥éš”å‡ å¤©èŠå‡ å¥æœ‰çš„æ²¡çš„ã€‚
ç›´åˆ°æ˜¥èŠ‚åœ¨å®¶ï¼Œè¢«å®¶äººäº²æˆšå„ç§å‚¬å»äººå®¶å®¶é‡Œè§é¢ã€‚
chunks.en:
At the end of last year, a relative introduced me to the younger sister of a friend of his. She was from the same hometown and in the same city. After adding her as a friend, my relative urged me to arrange a meeting before we even had a proper conversation.
Not being very proactive, I bit the bullet and sent an invitation, and we met. After dinner, we wandered around outside for an afternoon, not saying much at all. I felt mentally exhausted when I got back.
After that, we chatted about random things every few days.
Until the Spring Festival, when my family and relatives kept pushing me to meet her family at their home.

Eventually, she, her elder brother, his wife, and their family came to my place. My younger sister, my relative, and I received them at a nearby restaurant.
I acted very awkwardly at the dinner table, even a bit nervous. I didn't know how to properly host them.
After the meal, she and I strolled around a nearby shopping mall for an afternoon. We didn't say much during that time either. Around 6 PM, she suggested that we skip dinner, which relieved me, so we parted ways.

The next day, my relative said, 'We're just waiting for you to say the word to make it official.' I thought I'd give it a try, but I didn't even know what kind of relationship we were making official.

After returning to work after the New Year, I thought that chatting online every few days wasn't very meaningful. When I tried to arrange another meeting, I was actually rejected. She said, 'Let's talk about it later. We didn't talk much at the last meeting. We talked more on WeChat than in person.' I thought that made sense.
So, for a while after that, I started contacting her more frequently on WeChat than before. But it felt like there was very little interaction, even less than before our second meeting. She rarely asked me anything actively, which made me a bit frustrated.
I'm a slow starter, and being in this awkward situation is starting to affect my life.
I estimate our relationship is at about 30%. I was thinking that Valentine's Day is just around the corner, and I'm wondering if I should do something about it.
I'm shocked, why do men always reflect on whether the blind date problem is theirs?
Go look at Xiaohongshu, which woman on a blind date would reflect on whether the problem is theirs? All the posts are saying that the men on blind dates are weirdos/stingy.
I say, brother, please be more confident, okay?

chunks.en: When I saw this sentence of yours: 'I estimate our relationship is at about 30%. I was thinking that Valentine's Day is just around the corner, and I'm wondering if I should do something about it.' I felt that you're hopeless. The core reason why your relationship is lukewarm is because you didn't chat passionately when you met.
Either you boost your emotions at the next meeting, bring strong emotional value to the girl, then make a move, and finally get her into bed.

chunks.zh: è¦ä¹ˆä½ å°±ç›´æ¥æ‹œæ‹œï¼Œå› ä¸ºå¥¹å‹æ ¹æ²¡è®©ä½ æœ‰å¿ƒæ½®æ¾æ¹ƒçš„æ„Ÿè§‰å•Šï¼Œè¯´ç™½äº†æˆ‘çœ‹ä½ çš„è¡¨è¾¾ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯ä½ ä¸€ç‚¹éƒ½ä¸æƒ³å¹²å¥¹ä½ å®Œå…¨å¯¹å¥¹æ²¡æ€§æ¬²çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ï¼Œé‚£ä½ è¿˜èŠä¸ªé¸¡é”¤å­ï¼ŒæŠ“ç´§ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªå§
chunks.en: Or just say goodbye directly, because she doesn't make you feel excited at all. To put it bluntly, from your expression, I can tell that you don't want to sleep with her, you have absolutely no sexual desire for her, so why are you still chatting? Quickly move on to the next one.
Don't go on blind dates. Many men become simps after going on them.
And there's also a very rational but helpless problem: women are so boring. If it weren't for physiological needs, it's hard to have any common interests with them.

chunks.zh: æ¯”å¦‚æˆ‘å–œæ¬¢é­”æ–¹å’Œæ‚ æ‚ çƒï¼Œéš¾é“è¦å’Œä»–ä»¬èŠ cfop æˆ–è€… 4a çš„ soloham æ€ä¹ˆèµ·æ‰‹å—ï¼Ÿ
chunks.en: For example, I like Rubik's Cubes and yo-yos. Am I supposed to talk to them about CFOP or how to start 4A's soloham?
I don't think many women would be interested. There are many ways to combat nothingness, and finding a woman is the worst option.
You have no idea how proactive women can be when they take the initiative.
You can't trust the matchmaker's words during blind dates. You need to look at the other person's behavior. Unenthusiastic and inactive responses mean they're not interested.

Sometimes, the matchmaker will force both parties to continue in order to make it happen as much as possible, or pressure from parents and other parties will lead the other party to not explicitly refuse, because an explicit refusal requires an explanation to her parents and the matchmaker.

As a girl, you don't need to do anything. If you're sensible, you'll back down when you see the writing on the wall. If you're not sensible, she'll just half-heartedly brush you off, and you'll leave sooner or later. That way, it can be said that you didn't want to continue.

So, as a man, unless you're particularly thick-skinned or extremely satisfied with the other person and want to gamble on a small probability event, you should leave if you feel that the other person's attitude is not serious enough.
Run, next one.
You have to be friends before building an intimate relationship, so treat the other person as a friend first. If you don't even know how to get along with friends, then go practice making friends.
After making friends, you can rise from friends to boyfriend and girlfriend. Even blind dates are like that. If you're just settling, you should at least be friends first.
I don't want to be a simp ğŸ¤£ğŸ¶
Go straight to the topic of marriage to see what everyone's future looks like.
If it's good, then make it official. If it's not, don't waste time.

Although your relative sounds a bit outrageous, it's all accumulated experience. The optimal solution for blind dates is to meet once and say one sentence to confirm the relationship. If it's possible, then set a date.

My blind date process is: after adding each other on WeChat, we first introduce our general situation, talk about our values, what kind of person we like, and talk about our consumption habits to see if we are compatible. Then we directly make an appointment to meet, simply drink tea or coffee, to see if there is any chemistry and if we have any feelings for each other. If it's OK, we start sharing our daily lives, talking about our preferences, looking for common ground, and continuing to make appointments to meet and build relationships.
If your romantic experience is 0, don't enter the 'expert' arena of blind dates.

Guys, don't be unhappy first. Most girls on blind dates don't come with the idea of 'blind date.' Essentially, they still hope you take the initiative to approach her. Although this is quite unfair to the man on the blind date, after all, she might just say it's not suitable after you put in the effort. It still depends on your own mentality. It's not saying you want you to be a simp, but after all, you're a big man, so you must have the necessary tolerance and generosity. It depends on whether you want to find a straightforward girl who takes the initiative and has clear goals, or a passive, gentle girl who is easily guided by you. The girl in the original post has actually released her willingness to continue contact and is not disgusted. It's just that the original poster's performance in the first two times was too poor, not even a normal friend's contact. Imagine if your colleague came out to stroll and eat with you, and it was such an awkward situation, it probably wouldn't be appropriate.

Alas, seeing fellow programmers suffer in the emotional aspect is really painful for me. Don't just focus on technology. Dress up more, socialize more, and cultivate your temperament. Your love life is as important as your career.
I think it's because your character of neither taking the initiative nor rejecting made people misunderstand.

The girl should be eager to decide on the relationship. You're a slow starter and didn't really fancy her. The girl's feedback may be that you get along well, but in your mind, you're actually just thinking 'let's see how it goes,' otherwise relatives from both families wouldn't have met.
Later, when you 'warmed up,' the other party became less enthusiastic. The reasons may be: 1.
The girl may have found a blind date she likes.

She doesn't want to be clingy when the other party has clearly expressed 'I'm waiting for you to say the word to make the relationship official,' and you haven't expressed it. What's the point of talking about it?
Advice: 1.
Blind dates in the hometown are fast-paced. Either agree or reject unless both people express that they can try getting along first.
Being a slow starter is just being secretly horny. Change it.
Withdraw
There's just no chemistry, why force yourself?

Holding hands on a dimly lit path after dinner, taking off your underwear in a small hut with only two people, and the next day the woman takes the initiative to ask you to open a room, probably because she didn't succeed yesterday and is giving you a chance today, haha. The idea of love growing over time, deciding on a lifelong commitment after only a few meetings, how is that possible? If it doesn't work, move on to the next one. Experts go on 30 blind dates a year Women are rare commodities, but in some areas with a high proportion of women, it's the opposite, why don't you move to another place to work?
Probably blocked by appearance ğŸ˜¡, switch to the next one.
@Track13 There's also Brother Feng here ğŸ˜¡
You've probably been put in the provider position.
